data.title: My new favourite in Syracuse.
data.text: Small, intimate,classy without being fussy. Simple menu with delicious choices. Could have ordered any of the offerings but ended up with the rack of lamb. One of the better I have ever had. No hard liquor sold but only wine and beer. Wine was fairly priced. Service was gracious , competent and discrete. Can you tell I loved my dinner!

data.title: Disappointed!!!
data.text: I really wanted to like this place. I did some research to fine a nice place to celebrate parents weekend at Syracuse. The online menu looked pretty good, the reviews were mixed but many good ones. The curious thing was that I went to show my daughter the online menu before we arrived and it seemed to have been taken off the website? When we arrived for dinner, we were told the menu had been changed due to the high volume of guests over the weekend. OK? We ordered three different protein entrees, steak, duck and salmon. We waited FOREVER for our meals, tables around us who arrived before us were served and we waited and waited. Our meals finally arrived, all three had the exact same sides, mashed potatoes and brussel sprouts. Really? The duck was overcooked, the steak and salmon were ok. Not sure if something is going on in the kitchen, a chef crisis or something but for the prices they are charging, very expensive, we expected much better. Extremely disappointed.

data.title: Dinner before the show
data.text: I called and left a message to make a reservations at 5:30 pm for the night of the show at Crouse-Hinds Theater.  My call was returned by a very friendly man who verified we would be all set and they would be sure we had a wonderful meal and a relaxing experience and make it to the show on time.   He spoke the truth.   Our table was ready when we walked through the door, we were immediately attended to, and a wonderful "surprise" appetizer from the chef was brought to our table to start.  We ordered and received our salad.  Our meal followed and it was delectable.  We followed up with French press coffee and it was a wonderful ending to our meal.  We were able to sit for 1/2 hour enjoying our coffee and talking with enough time for a slow walk to the show.  Just as he said....a wonderful meal and relaxing experience.  We decided to make this our "go to" restaurant before the shows from now on!!

data.title: Excellent surprise!!!
data.text:
We were heading someplace else for dinner and ended up trying 317 instead. We came on a very busy night yet the owners were accommodating, friendly and welcoming. They went over menu changes which were to highlight fresh things they had gotten at market that morning. The two owners were the only front of house staff to wait on and tend bar to a full restaurant and bar yet they were relaxed and friendly and not frazzled. 

We started with the best crab cakes I've ever had followed by two delicious salads which came with our meals.  For dinner I had chicken francaise which came with zucchini and mashed potatoes.  It was all outstanding. The portion was large however a bit overpriced at $32. I didn't mind though since everything was so delicious. My husband got the halibut with mashed potatoes and roasted cauliflower. Again everything was made perfectly. 

We will definitely return to The 317. It's small and cozy with outstanding service and food!

data.title: Lots of class
data.text: Always a nice ipscale meal and service. Great staff. Easy parking on street, outside tables as well.

data.title: Dinner review
data.text: Exceeded my expectations. One of the finest nights out in a long time. Josh and Dean were gracious, attentive and just nice guys. The food was superb with the potato encrusted salmon (lightly seared to perfection!). The ambiance was wonderful with brick, green and natural wood tones and can be characterized as "Great Bones". Wine selection excellent with helpful recommendations by Josh. A few extras by the chef put us over the top. We will definitely be back.

data.title: Consistently a Delightful Experience!!
data.text: This is my second trip back (and I travel far) and it was an absolute delight. The staff is excellent. Their customer service skills are incredible. Our meals were delicious - salmon, duck, burger, salads - everything was wonderful.  We will be heading back for graduation and hopefully again sometime in between.

data.title: A Great Surprise
data.text: We were pleasantly surprised when entering this restaurant. We found the atmosphere, and food simply perfect. The owner has put his own personal touch in the décor of this beautiful establishment. At first glance you see a classy place with wonderful background music providing tasty food at a reasonable price. The service is there to please. I will return to this establishment on any future trips to Syracuse. The food is reasonably priced.

data.title: Favorite restaurant in Syracuse!
data.text:
I requested an intimate birthday dinner for my fiancé and Josh and Dean went above and beyond! It was a wonderful meal that I got to help custom create with lots of wine and amazing food. For our entrees he had the steak and I had red snapper both cooked to perfection. Everything was incredibly fresh and delicious! 

The attention to detail and ambiance made for a perfect evening. I couldn't have asked for a better birthday surprise! 

Needless to say we are coming back often for dinners and events.

data.title: Still our favorite place in Syracuse
data.text: I am not sure why this place isn't rated higher. We had dinner here last week and weren't disappointed. The staff is friendly,  prompt and knowledgeable. The menu is small, but well put together. The chef came out to say hello. The food was great. My only complaint is the shortage of Finger Lakes wine on the list.

data.title: Good find tucked away
data.text: Lovely little spot, tucked away in Syracuse downtown. Big Boy and I walked over after Cirque de Soleil show and it was a good choice. Started with complimentary amuse bouche of home made creamy mozzarella. Word of advice - bread is excellent but don't fill up on it. Big Boy always goes for seafood choice and was very pleased with pistachio crusted salmon. I opted for the Chicken Roulade w/pepper cream sauce (I'm a sucker for anything creamy. It was Ok ( rather dry but because of bread intake I couldn't finish it) Then I discovered that pastry left wasn't cooked long enough. When I mentioned it at the end, I was offered dessert but just couldn't manage it.  FYI, the rest rooms are down a flight of 17 steps, so it may be an issue to some people.

data.title: Good food but incredibly slow service
data.text: The food was good but not outstanding. We started with the cheese plate which took 25 minutes to arrive. 2 cheeses were outstanding (a smoked gouda and cheddar) but the feta and mozzarella were blah. There was one large party downstairs but the dining room was half empty. Had the Duck duo which was tasty but barely warm by the time I got it. Partner had the salmon which sounded great but was OK. Service was extremely slow throughout and server really did not engage us.

data.title: Hidden, Upscale, Perfect for Couples
data.text:
On the suggestion of a friend tried The 317 for dinner night - I was surprised to learn that it was hiding right around the corner from where I work, so super convenient.  

The interior and decor is really nice, trendy.  The bar is wine and beer only.  The menu while not the most expansive, had a lot of variety to it - reasonably priced, and the food was prepared to our liking.  

The night that we were there the server was wearing several hats, so just be patient and enjoy the night.  

All in all we were very pleased with our experience and plan on coming back soon.

data.title: An Upscale restaurant in Syracuse (one of the very few)!
data.text:
I had been looking for a restaurant to bring my parents for dinner, as they'd just helped me make the move to Syracuse. At first I was worried; nowhere seemed suitable to bring my rather aristocratic family for dinner. I was happy to find out that the perfect place was nestled directly underneath my new apartment. 
My accolades of this restaurant begin before you even enter it. The restaurant sits at sidewalk level in a historic building that's over 100 years old. Guests can sit in front of two large windows adjacent to the cove door that separates them and anyone walking by can appreciate the charm it exudes, practically inviting you in. 
The interior of the restaurant is enchanting with its small, lantern lit rooms, and tables topped with delicate crystal glasses and colorful wines; the history of the place has been immaculately well-preserved. 
The service is excellent. The restaurant is owned and operated by a couple who take pride in everything they do. Just a handful of people run the entire restaurant, and they seem like they're family. It's clear a lot of heart is put into preparing the meals they serve. 
My family and I ended up ordering an array of delicious dishes. We began with warm, freshly baked bread,  followed by truly gourmet salads, exquisite cuts of fish and beef, and a small, but delectable dessert menu that brought the night to a beautiful and elegant close.

data.title: The second good restaurant out of four we tried during dining week.
data.text:
We really enjoyed the food at this restaurant. A standout was the Baked white cheddar in buttery puff pastry with 
toasted almonds and orange marmalade  and the “BLT” Crisp Pork Belly, 
Microgreens and tomato reduction served with house made crostini for the starters. I enjoyed the Parsnip bisque with local honey and white Turkish figs.I wish I had gotten something other than the Haddock stuffed with crab. It was good, but needed more seasoning. It was fresh however. The atmosphere is very nice and the service was spot on. Thank you for an enjoyable night out.

data.title: All excellent and quite tasty.
data.text:
We were all very happy with our choices ( and the choices the staff suggested...after asking us what we especially liked).
We'll certainly be back!

data.title: Hidden Gem
data.text: The location of this restaurant may be a little off the main drag for business; most people are unlikely to be strolling past and wonder about the place.  (Since I have lived here it has been at least 4 restaurants).  ANYHOW, my advice is to go.  I have had very good food (nice ingredients, beautifully prepared) here every time I have come since the current restaurant has been in place. The menu the last time seems pared back, which I think is a good idea; no bad choices, and everyone enjoyed the meal.  The wine list is well done.  The folks who run the restaurant are present and accountable.  I will keep it at top of mind and recommend to people looking for a spot for a carefully put together meal.

data.title: Some good some not so much
data.text: The setting is very pretty, the wait staff is great, but the food is uneven at best.  Pizza crust burnt and waitress insisted to the chef that it be redone.  She had to do that?

data.title: Some hits, some misses
data.text: Heard a lot of good things about this place, but it was not outstanding.  Amuse bouche was a sweet bite of lemon pastry which was also one of the homemade desserts, not a good way to start your meal.  The appetizer selections looked interesting so maybe that would be worth a try, but we just wanted to do entrees and salad.  The warm bread and dip was good, the salad was just some field greens and one cherry tomato with an overly tangy vinaigrette.  The vegetable stir fry with added shrimp was delicious, but the seafood scampi had under cooked pasta that was stuck together.  It had a decent mix of crab, lobster claw meat, and nice size shrimp, with not much flavor.  We had the dessert at the beginning and none of the list had a chocolate flavor so we passed.   Glad to see a couple of finger lakes wines even though they were over priced.  As for service the knife had a big thumb print on it, and we were not offered pepper for salad, or replacement silver with our entrees.  When the check was presented we gave a credit card. The server returned with an ipad type processor which asked you to enter a gratuity while the server watched.  Then he had to go back to the main computer to print out the credit receipt.  The whole thing was awkward and time consuming, not worth the trouble.  They need to make some adjustments if they want to be called a great dining experience.

data.title: Yummy!
data.text:
The 317 has a small but elegant menu. I believe it changes, so I would go back to see the new items next season for sure! They place was honestly a little too bright for dinner Friday night. A nice dim setting would have been more welcoming. No one greeted us which I thought was weird bc we had a reservation. Oh well we went to the bar where a nice woman served us our drinks and told us we could head to our reserved table whenever we were ready. Our waiter came to our table with amuse of duck wontons. Wow make your mouth water kind of dish! So good. I had the special of the night which was a pork shank, fell off the bone as I was told it would. I also had the made from scratch chili which was wonderful. My boyfriend had the duck leg, it was also great! Just a little fatty but still tasty! 
This place is priced at about $30 per meal so I wouldn't go unless you check the small menu online before to know you'll find something you like! None the less check out 317 because their chef is very talented.
